image.altText: A house with police tape around it and an officer standing in front of it

props.synopsis: A man dies after suffering a medical episode minutes after being tasered during a police arrest in the Perth suburb of Embleton overnight.

title.children: Man dies during police arrest in suburban Perth after being tasered

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man wearing a surgical mask, sunglasses and navy cap

props.synopsis: A Transperth bus driver who hit and killed a pedestrian near Perth Arena in "abysmal" weather conditions avoids an immediate jail term.

title.children: ‘Not an accident’: Perth bus driver sentenced over pedestrian death

image.altText: Three people standing, posing for a photo with hands clasped

props.synopsis: Three commissioners tasked with getting the trouble-plagued Nedlands council in order say the referral of the local government to WA's corruption watchdog came as "a surprise".

title.children: City of Nedlands' referral to CCC surprises council's commissioners

image.altText: A large shipped docked at a berth on the sea at Alcoa's Kwinana facility.

props.synopsis: A tanker due to dock this week in Kwinana, near Perth, is laden with banned Russian oil, say Ukrainian and Australian campaigners calling on the Albanese government to intervene.

title.children: Claims Russian 'blood oil' fuelling motorists as tanker nears WA

image.altText: Steven James Naoum walks outside court wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Perth orthodontist Steven James Naoum, 46, pleads not guilty to choking a boy at a junior soccer match in Perth's north.

title.children: Trial expected for parent who allegedly choked 11yo boy at soccer match

image.altText: Frost set on a car

props.synopsis: Perth shivers through its coldest morning since 2010 as the metro station in Mount Lawley records a low of 0.3C, with temperatures plummeting to sub-zero in some suburbs.

title.children: Coldest morning in 15 years delivers freezing temperatures around Perth

image.altText: A line of large trucks carrying hay bales travel down the Eyre Highway

props.synopsis: More than 80 trucks loaded with more than 6,000 bales of hay and straw from WA is heading for drought-stricken parts of South Australia.

title.children: WA's farming community rallies to help drought-hit SA

image.altText: A sign saying radio quiet zone against the backdrop of a night sky and a satellite

props.synopsis: Global satellite internet service Starlink could interfere with the world's largest radio telescope being built in Western Australia's Murchison, a new study reveals.

title.children: Starlink satellites disrupting astronomy radio quiet zone, study finds

image.altText: AC/DC pose for a band photo in 1976.

props.synopsis: As triple j's Hottest 100 countdown of Australian songs approaches, a small country town reflects on the Aussie music icons that played there during the "golden age" of rock 'n' roll.

title.children: Inside AC/DC's $3.20 outback Australian gig in the '70s

image.altText: An elderly man in a striped collared shirt sits in a chair outside. He is talking off camera and his arm is raised pointing

props.synopsis: A tenant advocacy group says long-term caravan park residents in regional Western Australia who are weeks from eviction are largely unaware of their rights.

title.children: Eviction date approaches for long-term caravan park residents

image.altText: A Fremantle AFL player punches a West Coast player during a melee between the two sides during a game.

props.synopsis: To mark this weekend's series of interstate rivalry games, we look back at the best of the AFL era — from the Demolition Derby to a Swans-GWS elimination final.

title.children: Thrillers and thumpings — what are the best AFL state rivalry games in history?

image.altText: The side of a sketch of Donna Nelson's head.

props.synopsis: Tokyo's High Court rejects expert evidence defence lawyers hoped would overturn drug trafficking charges against a Perth grandmother.

title.children: Tokyo court rejects key evidence in jailed Perth grandmother's appeal bid

image.altText: An aerial image of a small boat on clear blue water, with a line of passengers disembarking onto the beach.

props.synopsis: Some tour operators hope a UNESCO listing of the Murujuga Cultural Landscape can help the Pilbara shake its mining reputation.

title.children: 'People will come' but is Karratha ready for a tourism surge?

image.altText: A man in a fluro vest folding his arms and standing in a driveway

props.synopsis: Mitchell Forth, one of those found guilty of killing 15-year-old Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey, is seeking leave to appeal his manslaughter conviction, court documents reveal.

title.children: Cassius Turvey killer seeks appeal against manslaughter conviction

image.altText: Sign showing Ramsay

props.synopsis: Ramsay Health Care are set to close 17 of their 20 psychology clinics across the country potentially leaving thousands of vulnerable patients in limbo.

title.children: Ramsay Health to close psychology clinics in West Perth and Mount Pleasant

image.altText: A man wearing a bandana ripping off a t-shirt to show another t-shirt bearing Donald Trump's name.

props.synopsis: Hogan is widely credited with transforming America's wrestling scene into a family entertainment spectacle, but courted controversy in his later years as his private life overtook his public persona.

title.children: Hulk Hogan, wrestling superstar whose private life made headlines, dies at 71

image.altText: A huge tree lies across a road in a suburban area

props.synopsis: Residents say a freak tornado that ripped through Perth's coastal suburbs sounded "like a jet engine" as it fell trees and tore up the roofs of homes.

title.children: Freak tornado 'like a jet engine' damages homes in Perth

image.altText: Ben O'Connor on Tour de France podium after stage 18.

props.synopsis: Having long considered the Tour de France a relentless and unforgiving challenge, Ben O'Connor roars back with a stunning stage 18 victory in the Alps to finally bury memories of the crashes he has suffered in recent years.

title.children: West Aussie O'Connor tames 'cruel race' to win Tour de France stage

image.altText: A man with grey hair in a polo shirt.

props.synopsis: Tony Simpson says it is well within the WA government's power to authorise the effective takeover of the Shire of Coolgardie by the City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder.

title.children: Locals fear lost identity as pressure mounts on struggling council

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has celebrated Australia's decision to lift biosecurity import restrictions on US beef, saying his country will "sell so much" beef to Australia.

title.children: Donald Trump says he wants to 'sell so much' beef to Australia — as it happened

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in reports related to Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: A photo of the City of Nedlands sign with the postcode 6009 included

props.synopsis: The referral is for a separate matter aside from recent controversies including the council refusing to give up land for a children's hospice and four councillors resigning in a day.

title.children: City of Nedlands referred to Corruption and Crime Commission

image.altText: A black and white selfie of a smilihng girl with blonde hair tied back, black tee, chain and pendant around neck.

props.synopsis: Worksafe initiated the court action after Paige Counsell died at the Big Bell Gold site in WA's Murchison region.

title.children: Miner fined $945,000 over worker's death, safety training 'ineffective'

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX is on track to hit its worst week since April, remaining in the red after a day of losses. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX on track to hit worst week since April, miners and gold stocks weigh

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 🎥 Awkward on-camera exchange between Powell and Trump
Share market closes lower after day in the red

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Those who paid off their student loans quickly before indexation rose may regret that decision, now that HECS-HELP debts are set to be slashed by 20 per cent.

title.children: Student debt regret: What it means for those who have paid off HECS

image.altText: A close-up on a man's hand gripping the steering wheel. A mobile phone sits in its mount on the dashboard.

props.synopsis: Insurance company analysis shows lane departure warning and lane keeping assist are the least popular features.

title.children: Do you turn off driver assist tech in your vehicle? You're not alone

image.altText: Psychologist holds a teenage girl's hands while balancing a clipboard on her lap.

props.synopsis: Patients and health experts say psychological screening prior to bariatric surgery may help identify people with eating disorders, and counter potential mental health impacts of the life-changing procedure.

title.children: Bariatric surgery patients at risk of eating disorders, calls for psychological screenings

image.altText: Lauren Black with son Bastian and Grandma Linda

props.synopsis: Lauren says suddenly having to fill the shoes of her mum, which included moving back to her hometown to care for her dad while also raising her toddler, was a strain on her marriage.

title.children: 'Lovers to logistic managers': How caring for aging parents strains relationships

image.altText: Science lab

props.synopsis: The solution to Australia's productivity problem could be more investment in research and development, and a new tax on big business might be one way to achieve that.

title.children: Calls to tax big businesses that don't invest in new technology

image.altText: triple j's Abby & Tyrone wearing Hottest 100 of Australian songs merch laughing together

props.synopsis: This Saturday, we find out what Australia considers to be the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Your guide to the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: The opposition leader faces a diabolical situation with the debate over whether the Coalition should abandon the 2050 net zero target.

title.children: Zero positives for Sussan Ley in the Coalition's net zero battle

image.altText: Ali France and Albanese

props.synopsis: From the return of federal parliament to a fresh debate on the "spirit of cricket", it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Federal parliament returns, the 'spirit of cricket' and a top dog

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained confronting footage appearing to show a young female supermarket worker being kicked to the ground by an older male ride-share driver, in an alleged assault.

title.children: 'Terrified' young supermarket worker allegedly assaulted by Uber driver
